alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 04 at 3:05PM MST until January 06 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Storm total accumulations of 18 to 36 inches in the mountains and 4 to 8 inches in Uinta County Wyoming and the Bear River Valley. Winds gusts in excess of 50 mph will result in areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. In Utah, Bear Lake and Bear River Valley, Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Expect winter driving conditions including snow covered roads and greatly reduced visibility. Areas of blowing snow may reduce visibility to near zero at times. The snow will impact the Wednesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Interstate 80 in northeast Utah and southwest Wyoming as well as Sardine and Logan Summits in Utah will be especially prone to blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511. For winter road conditions from the Wyoming Department of Transportation, visit http://www.wyoroad.info or dial 511.
